title: Clean Water Usage
content: Always boil water for at least 1 minute before drinking, cooking, or brushing teeth. If boiling is not possible, use water purification tablets or bleach (2 drops per quart).

title: Food Storage and Handling
content: Keep perishable foods refrigerated or in coolers with ice. Discard any food that has been at room temperature for more than 2 hours. Wash hands before and after handling food.

title: Hand Washing Technique
content: Wash hands with soap and clean water for at least 20 seconds, especially before eating, after using the bathroom, and after handling debris. Use hand sanitizer (60%+ alcohol) when soap is unavailable.

title: Treating Minor Cuts and Wounds
content: Clean wounds immediately with clean water and soap. Apply antibiotic ointment and cover with a clean bandage. Change bandages daily and watch for signs of infection (redness, swelling, pus).

title: Waste Disposal
content: Use designated toilet facilities when available. If not, dig a cat hole 6-8 inches deep and at least 200 feet from water sources. Bury waste properly and wash hands thoroughly afterward.

title: Preventing Mosquito-Borne Illness
content: Eliminate standing water where mosquitoes breed. Use insect repellent containing DEET. Wear long sleeves and pants during dawn and dusk when mosquitoes are most active.

title: Dental Care During Crisis
content: Brush teeth twice daily with clean water. If toothpaste is unavailable, use baking soda or just brush with water. Floss regularly to prevent infections.

title: Recognizing Dehydration
content: Watch for signs: extreme thirst, dark urine, dizziness, fatigue, dry mouth. Drink clean water regularly even if not thirsty. Seek medical help for severe dehydration symptoms.

title: Identifying Spoiled Food
content: Discard any food with unusual odor, color, or texture. When in doubt, throw it out. Never taste food to determine if it's safe. Check expiration dates carefully.

title: Respiratory Health
content: Wear N95 masks when around dust, mold, or debris. Cover coughs and sneezes with elbow. Avoid close contact with sick individuals. Ventilate indoor spaces when possible.

title: Cleaning and Disinfection
content: Clean surfaces with soap and water first, then disinfect with diluted bleach solution (1/3 cup bleach per gallon of water). Let surfaces air dry. Wear gloves during cleaning.

title: Heat Exhaustion Prevention
content: Stay hydrated and take frequent breaks in shade. Wear light-colored, loose clothing. Watch for symptoms: heavy sweating, weakness, nausea, headache. Move to cool area and hydrate if symptoms appear.
